channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024040778
item.description:
Report X-2024040778

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the manager opened the trailer, she noticed a spilled and she called QA. DescribePack: the container got punctured and spilled out about 1.5 gallons. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA went to the area and cleaned the spilled and brought all the damaged package to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040767
item.description:
Report X-2024040767

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS PULLING OFF THE BELT, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT SINCE THE PACKAGE WAS WET. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS LEAKING CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB MATERIAL. ONCE IT WAS SAFE AND SECURE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS ON ITS SIDE ON THE IC BELT AND CAUSED THE 5-GALLON CONTAINER TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report X-2024040430
item.description:
Report X-2024040430

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on its side at end of NC belt and when turned back up right it started to leak content. QA was called and secured the package for processing. DescribePack: bottles looked to have leaked and had loose caps on all four bottles. they were in a plastic bag were most of the leak content was contained until it was turned back over and leaked from a hole in bag, saturating the bottom of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: most of it was contained inside package itself and was discovered pretty quickly

item.title: Report X-2024040432
item.description:
Report X-2024040432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND LEAKING. THEY INFORMED THEIR MANAGER OF THE SITUATION AND THEY IN TURN INFORMED QA OF THE PROBLEM. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. ONCE THE AREA WAS SECURE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND USED A PH STRIP ON THE PACKAGE AND NOTICED IT WAS HAZARDOUS AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED ON ITS SIDE FOR SHIPPING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND A PH STRIP WAS USED TO DETERMINE TO SEE IF IT WAS HAZARDOUS. ONCE IT WAS DISCOVERED IT WAS, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024040380
item.description:
Report X-2024040380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE HANDLER WHO WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING INSIDE THE TRAILER. THEY GRABBED A TOTE AND PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN IT AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD TO INVESTIGATE THE ISSUE AND SAW THE PACKAGE HAD BEEN MOVED TO A TOTE. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A DIFFERENT TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG. ONCE THE PACKAGE WAS SECURE, THEY BROUGHT IT BACK AND PLACED INSIDE THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE WHICH LED TO THE CONTAINERS LEAKING OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2024040222
item.description:
Report X-2024040222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED QA. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND THE SPILL WAS CLEANED UP. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PAIL WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE BUNGHOLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.
